content: buttercup baby cardigan © allison elliott / fleur de lovely designs 2008 needles us 7 circular 16 or longer us 7 dpns if you wish to work sleeves in the round sizes to fit 6 9 12 months yarn 1 2 2 bernat cotton tots 100% cotton in sunshine or other worsted weight other supplies waste yarn darning needle 4 stitch markers sizing note bear in mind that cotton yarns will shrink when machine-dried if you wish to allow for shrinkage you may wish to use a slightly larger gauge or work more repeats of the raglan increase row whether using cotton acrylic or wool it s best to knit a swatch and launder/block it as you will care for the sweater to test whether it shrinks grows or remains true to size abbreviations pm = place marker sm = slip marker kfb = knit through front and back of same stitch to increase instructions co 32 36 40 with circular needles work 1 k1p1 ribbing raglan set-up row k1 p1 k1 p1 k2 3 4 pm k4 pm k12 14 16 pm k4 pm k 3 4 5 p1 k1 p1 these stitch markers will guide you as you complete the raglan shaping fom here onward work the first and last four stitches of every row in k1p1 ribbing as established raglan shaping row 1 and all ws row purl keeping first and last 4 stitches of each row in k1p1 ribbing as established row 2 and all rs row k to 1 stitch before marker kfb sm kfb repeat at each marker repeat row 1 and 2 until diagonal raglan increase line from underarm to base of collar measures 5 5 6 5 7 5 work one more repeat of row 1 separating sleeves from body k to first marker keeping first and last 4 stitches in rib pattern remove marker using darning needle move sleeve stitches to waste yarn until you reach next marker tie off waste yarn and remove marker k across back repeat putting sleeve stitches on waste yarn for second sleeve k to end of row body all ws row purl all rs row knit continue body of sweater until it measures 4 6 7 from armholes work 1 k1p1 ribbing bind off loosely sleeves transfer stitches of one sleeve from waste yarn to dpns may use straight or circular needle and work sleeve flat if you wish 1st round pm at beginning of round knit 2nd round k1 k2tog k to within 3 stitches of marker ssk k1 3rd round knit 4th round repeat 2nd decrease round work in stockinette for 3 4 5 6 work 4 row k1p1 ribbing bind off loosely repeat for second sleeve weave in all loose ends closure options i closed the sweater by making two lengths of crochet chain 6 long and sewing them on as ties see picture you may work buttonholes in the front placket if desired working the rib section as k1 yo k2tog
